Designing Gumroad

Lead Product Designer – May 2014 to November 2015

A breakdown of my approach to three core features focused on helping creatives of all types make a living online.

  • Onboarding
  • Audience
  • Discover

Onboarding new users Creators

Since it's inception in 2011, Gumroad's feature set had grown extensively beyond "a way to ask folks to pay for downloads," and in early 2015, we began exposing more of those tools. I accomplished this by creating a system of interstitial views in collaboration with @amiruci and @shl, aptly named "Greeters". From gathering information to generating understanding and excitement for a given feature, using Greeters was a simple and straight-forward way to make creators more successful, faster.

Helping creators build their audience

Gumroad has always been an excellent tool for those that already have an audience; but for those who don't, our creators are largely left to their own devices. In July of 2015, I designed a suite of improvements meant to make profiles simple, high-converting pages where new creators foster sustainable relationships with people interested in supporting them and their work.

Selling more with Gumroad Discover

Starting the in October of 2015, Gumroad decided to tackle an often requested feature designed to help creators grow beyond their existing audience entitled Gumroad Discover.
